Topic.Title: Cramer on NVDA : "It's a Very Expensive Stock that isn't performing."

Message.Msg: "on IGNORE you go !!!" Perhaps you find the Words of Cramer, well, irritating to your delicate sensibilities? And so you may decide to ignore the words of Jim Cramer, if you wish. But rest assured. The other Six Million (6,000,000) astute traders viewing CNBC sure won't. Which reminds me. One of the 101 uses for Duck Tape? To hold down the "Sell" button while the trader visits the Gentleman's Room. Time IS Money, don't u know. And ya hate to be pizzing-away money.

Topic.Title: Jon Peddie Numbers

Message.Msg: Thanks for posting... PC market, even if they gain share, is perceived to be shrinking... or at least not expanding... NVidia needs to go into new markets... and will with the ARM64 era... "This was a not a very good quarter." Yet NVidia had a record Q... but guided down for next Q...

Topic.Title: Jon Peddie Numbers

Message.Msg: Here's the numbers that really matter, boys. From Jon Peddie Research. For the First Half of 2012, the market shares for mobile SoCs (System-on-a-Chip) with 3D graphics -- you know, for smartphones and tablets -- are as follows. 26.7% __ Qualcomm Incorporated 22.2% __ Samsung Electronics Co. Ltd. 21.1% __ Apple Inc. 20.0% __ Other Manufacturers 7.5% ___ Texas Instruments, Inc. 2.5% ___ nvidia That's it, boys. All that carnival barking, and for what? A teeny-tiny 2.5% of the smartphone and tablet market for the nvidia tegra. Ha ha ha ha ha ha! Google it, boys : Jon Peddie Researchâ€”Press Releases Most mobile SoCs GPUs shipped by Qualcomm in first half. Posted by Jon Peddie on October 26th 2012

Topic.Title: Cramer on NVDA : "It's a Very Expensive Stock that isn't performing."

Message.Msg: "It's a Very Expensive Stock that isn't performing." "Kill the Tegra." "Kill the Tegra."

Topic.Title: Jon Peddie Numbers

Message.Msg: This is a glass is half empty interpretation. I think with the macro events turning positive, there will be a tendency to look at this data as half full. The percentages listed are enough to support the full too. Any analyst that really understands the numbers can see the percentages are better then the losses due to shrinkage of the overall market. And if you did listen to the guidance in the CC, Jen actually said he is being conservative with the numbers. The guidance was only down a fraction compared to Intel fr example.

Topic.Title: Cramer on NVDA : "It's a Very Expensive Stock that isn't performing."

Message.Msg: Thanks Best! Thanks for posting that great CNBC video of Jim Cramer's Lightning round. I particularly liked that part around 2:47 in the video. Where he speaks about nvda. "The stock has been doing ABSOLUTELY NOTHING, which is a Problem." "It's a VERY EXPENSIVE STOCK that isn't performing." I have created a short-cut on my desktop, so I can watch and re-watch it. Over and over -- at my leisure. Perhaps other readers at home would like to do the same? Here it is again : Lightning Round - CNBC Mon 26 Nov 12 After you Google it, just right click, and pick "Create shortcut". And Presto! -- It's saved on your desktop for future reference. Also Best, thanks for the timely and practical tip on the use for Duck Tape. How come the pumper boys never bring us Great Content like you do? You're well, the Best.

Message.Title: pumper boyz all up in arms over
Message.Msg: one 'good' Q when nvda had $240M in sales and 'only' lost $40M. Never mind this Q they will do only $160M in sales and incur a $100M loss. Never mind sales will continue for the next full year to drop and drop and drop, while loses will go up and up and up. and also never mind nothing had changed: #1 & 2 in mobile will continue to do their own processors and remain out of reach of 3rd ARM processor suppliers, #3 will continue to be cheap only, and #4 will continue to 'spread the wealth'. Not enough core competence in cpu design, no viable program.... the only ones bearing the loses are the shareholders. The head of the company goes just for flash, and you see in here too by the posts of the pumper boyz - try to impress with headlines only, not one word about whether the business strategy is viable or not.

Topic.Title: Cramer's Back . . .

Message.Msg: It was a lightning round that he said that. He has to give a quick opinion on many many stocks during that part. Its hard to say how much he knows and what he's basing his opinion on when he has to cover just about every stock out there. Then he sums it up in a sentence or two based on what he knows at the time. The lightning round is the least informative part of his show. Cramer is good for spotting trends, insight into how funds/hedge funds act and when a pre-recorded show airs, lots of generic market tips.

Topic.Title: So, who got in during the sale?

Message.Msg: After the CC, I was itching to buy more Nvidia. When I saw that it *dropped*, I did a lot of frantic digging to figure out what went wrong. I saw nothing but positives and future upside. Especially at these low valuations. Nvidia is now my largest position. I think this goes to $20+ over the next year or two.

Message.Title: Did nVidia win on the New Apple Macs to be released Firday?
Message.Msg: New Macs are coming out Friday. Is this why the stock is going up? Anyone know?

Message.Title: Diluted value?
Message.Msg: Am long, but wish I wasn't. The last SEC announcement was Xmas time for the option receivers. They allotted 32 million shares for options and since they only have a total of approx. 600 million shares issued that makes a substantial dilution for existing shareholders. Other companies are issuing special dividends, using cash to purchase other viable companies, or paying down debt. Not our boys! They bought a bunch of future options and probably bonuses for the present BoD and management. I know about the small dividend. I have been a stockholder of other tech companies driven by ego and with an utter disdain for stockholders and can't seem to learn my lesson. Should take the loss, but should probably wait to next year when the loss means more. If any of this is incorrect please opine. This stock seems to be going nowhere!

Topic.Title: Did nVidia win on the New Apple Macs to be released Firday?

Message.Msg: according to release I read today nVidia is the graphics card in BOTH high end macs coming out this week. Nice win fo nvda!!

Could alos be the news today of hte Apple wins. Coudl be news we dont know about yet but those in the know are accumulating. And lastly though not necc. independently, it could be NVDA may be the target of a buyout bid under consideration. again I dont have any special or inside knowledge whatsoever. We can only go by what the technical indicators are telling us. So shortie be dam*ed NVDA is going Up, UP and away!

Topic.Title: So, who got in during the sale?

Message.Msg: I posted buys here real time and feel great about my buys at 12 and pennies and then when it went down after the CC I posted that I doubled up in the mid 11's. Thank you for all your alpha pieces as they help outline the situation. It is far easier to get aggresive when cash represents almost half the stock value of NVDA. Add to that the many, many oars nvda has in the water and the existing business will be the backbone making this a safe investment; meanwhile the various new initiatives only need the pie to grow to allow a huge spike in earnings down the road. I cant say I totally understand why the market works the way it does and does not price firms accordingly (often it seems participants do not understand or want to do the work to understand the potential) , but time and time again we see funds (aka 'real money') waiting until AFTER a company is well on its way to huge profits before getting in. That's fine... it gives us 'little' guys a chance to get in early and wait for more conservative money to pour in and drive up the price later. Good fortune to you!

Message.Title: It's been so long since NVDA had a big run...
Message.Msg: The stock used to make big moves routinely, sometimes doubling in 6 months or less. Of course, the market is a little rougher now... Any chance NVDA makes another major move soon, perhaps into the $20s?

Topic.Title: easy short above 12.25

Message.Msg: too easy - NVDA has done nothing yet. desperate longs are going gaga because it's green for a change. Remember NVDA was trading near 13 when they released earnings. Most semi (other than PC related) have recovered and then some. Heck even MRVL is up 20% since hitting its lows. NVDA is only a reliable buy if it breaks 12.80 level on BIG Volume, not small manipulated volume.

Topic.Title: So, who got in during the sale?

Message.Msg: Even if the fiscal cliff is avoided, the market is headed toward another recession. The economy is slowing down. The only thing Obama has been doing the past 4 years is "buying" an OK economy by throwing money at it instead of letting the market recover naturally. Meanwhile, hiring and the GDP have slowed year over year, regulations have increased by thousands and now taxes are about to go up on everyone to pay for Obamacare. Don't count on this stock doing much until Obama is out of office and people realize they should have hired a Republican instead of a spender in chief.

Topic.Title: AMD Plans to Sell 58 Acre Austin Site and Lease Back to raise Cash

Message.Msg: Technical background to me is Chemistry, Physics, Math, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, etc. His degree is a bachelorâ€™s degree in Information Systems from Hartwick College and then he went into sales and marketing and moved up the IBM corporate ladder. Not very technical to me. Heaven forbid....I bet he doesn't even understand what his engineers tell him. It's all about the marketing #$%$. Mark my words. AMD will fold very soon and Rory Reed and that #$%$ Chairman (Another IBM marketing executive) who pays himself 875K a year for 8 meetings a year will make millions in golden parachutes as 10,000 people go out the door. Oh by the way JP Morgan will pick up huge restructuring fees too. LOL But Nvidia will pick up $300M a quarter in discrete GPU sales and Intel will get most of the $1B per quarter in X86 microprocessor revenue. Very sad for anyone who spent anytime in the semiconductor industry to see AMD run into the ground like this guy has done!

Topic.Title: AMD Plans to Sell 58 Acre Austin Site and Lease Back to raise Cash

Message.Msg: What IP is available? Really.....They have a cross licensing agreement with Intel. One for all and all for one. Would you pay good money so you could compete against Intel in X86?...that's all that is there. Nothing else. Besides Intel has the Nvidia IP that they are paying for and Nvidia is providing our dividend from. LOL Nvidia picks up all discrete GPU revenue and Intel picks up the remains of AMD APU sales. If you don't believe me go into Best Buy.....nothing on the shelf from AMD. Very sad day for Semiconductor professionals. AMD belly up! Honestly very Sad!!!!! P.S. - Look at the top executives history at the AMD website. They are all Marketing people. Nobody is left from the AMD cadre of Intel fighters and certainly nobody left from ATI. Marketing Forever un to bankruptcy! JP Morgan says bring on the Fees!
